Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different plants and animals in their natural habitats.
The student can label where the different plants and animals live (e.g., fish in water, deer in the forest).
The student can show what the plants and animals need to survive in their drawings (e.g., water, sunlight, food).
The student can illustrate and label how animals and plants get the resources they need from their habitat.
The student can represent and describe how different habitats provide resources that living things need.
